meanings.definition: to bring oneself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them
meanings.sent1: She tried to ingratiate herself with the teacher by complimenting his lessons.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to ingratiate himself with his new colleagues by offering to help with their projects.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to ingratiate itself with the family by wagging its tail and licking everyone's hands.
meanings.sent4: The politician attempted to ingratiate himself with the voters by promising lower taxes.
meanings.sent5: The salesperson tried to ingratiate herself with the customer by offering a discount on the product.

meanings.definition: to gain favor or acceptance by deliberate effort
meanings.sent1: The new student tried to ingratiate himself with his classmates by sharing his snacks.
meanings.sent2: She managed to ingratiate herself with the team by always being willing to help out.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to ingratiate itself with the dog by bringing it a toy as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The artist hoped to ingratiate himself with the critics by showcasing his latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The employee tried to ingratiate himself with the boss by staying late to finish a project.
